availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles J. Grim (Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer, tax commiss, & pvt 5th KY Inf CSA)

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer, tax commissioner, and soldier. Floyd County, Kentucky, native. Son of Charles J. Grim and Elizabeth Grim. Married to Sarah Ann Stumbaugh Grim in Johnson County on July 21, 1859. Father of Samuel Grim and Charles J. Grim. Student in Johnson County in 1850. Farmer in employ of Samuel Stumbaugh in Johnson County in 1860. Farmer in Johnson County in 1863. Served in the 5th Kentucky Infantry (C.S.A.) as a private.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 110B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 232.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, Hoods Fork, p. 149B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Film #994027-994058, Johnson County Marriages, 1852-1914, pp. 201-02.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Kentucky, 9th Congressional District, Johnson County, Vol. 1 of 3, October 1863, p. 146 (Accessed via ancestry.com on August 13, 2020).
Find A Grave, “Charles Jefferson “Jeff” Grim (1836-1914)," Memorial 164982967, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/164982967 (accessed August 13, 2020).
